The idea of being labeled a dog-fucker does not seem all that appealing to you, particularly if the management wanted to press charges. Oh well, what’s done is done, you decide to yourself. Fortunately for you, the hotel supplied your room with grooming supplies. Maybe a bath and a good brushing will hide the evidence of your dirty deed, at least until you were far away from this place. Anyway, the dog was as much in on it as you were. You won’t tell, and the dog can’t tell, so all you have to do is play it cool and get out before they have a chance to examine Polly more closely. “I sure am glad you can’t talk.” You speak out loud to the German shepherd female, your voice sounding very odd to you for some reason.

“Oh, but I can talk, lover.” The dog replies simply.
111131112211.title: You spend the rest of the night asleep on the b...

1111311122111.content:
You are suddenly very awake, shouting out loud with surprise as the sound echoes back off the tile wall as more of a YIPE! You try to get up, but something's wrong. Your arms and legs aren't bending properly as they slip on the polished marble floor, your legs flailing wildly until you find yourself sprawled out on your back. “What the hell?!” You look at your hands and realize they aren’t hands, but paws! Golden tan furry paws, linking to long thin legs and a mostly tan furry body that stretches out across the floor below you. “What the hell is going on?!”

“Calm down, lover, calm down.” The blond German shepherd moves toward you, but stops short as you spin around, snarling. “What the hell did you do to me?!”

“Relax, lover.” Polly speaks calmly while carefully keeping her distance. “If you want to stand up, you will have to listen to me. Understand?” You nod in reply as Polly sits down. “Roll over until your legs are under you. Good. Now pull back your front paws until they're flat on the floor. Don’t worry about your back legs yet, just push up with your fronts until you are sitting up. That’s it.” You follow her instructions, managing to get your head up off the floor, as Polly's long fluffy tail thumps on the marble with satisfaction.

Now, better able to look around, you get a chance to see yourself. Your fur is mostly golden tan with black fur pattern on your back that curves down like a saddle, going back to tan where a long fluffy black and tan tail extends out past your furry rump. Instinctively you take a sniff, recoiling slightly at the unfamiliar smell. Is this you? Very slowly, you bite down on your furry flank, feeling the sharp sensation of teeth on your skin as you taste dog. Yes, this is you.

“Now I want you to stand up.” Polly gets your attention again. “Roll your hindquarter until your back is off the floor, and then push up with your back legs while at the same time lean forward on your front legs. Good!” You just manage to stand, shaky as a newborn fawn as you struggle to maintain your balance.

“You were really amazing last night. Most of my clients just grab my tail and stick it in.” Polly starts to get up, but sits down again. “Do you mind if I get a little closer?

“No, I don’t mind.” You reply calmly as the other dog approaches you cautiously before sniffing at your flank. It has to be a dream, you decide to yourself. A weird dream, or maybe you were hypnotized like a magician might do to a hapless audience member as a way of getting a laugh. Polly continues to sniff, focusing on your tail, but without the frenetic enthusiasm she displayed last night. “Are you real?” You ask her as she stops short on her exploration to face you. “I mean, are you a real dog?”

“I am now.” Polly replies cryptically as she returns to sniffing at you.

“But you can talk!” You experimentally take a sniff in Polly’s direction, inhaling her scent mixed with your own human sweat that had soaked into the fur, and something else… A chemical of some sort, maybe flea powder or soap.

“Actually, I was speaking to you all the time.” Polly’s tongue lolls out again as she gives you a canine smile. “It’s only now that you can understand me.” Polly steps back, looking you over as you hold still, concentrating on staying on your new feet.

“You know, you really are an impressive specimen….um…..what’s your name?”

“Max.” You answer automatically.

“Max….Max…” Polly rolls the name around for a moment. “A good dog name. You must have been really into me last night if you managed a transformation this complete. I thought I was into it, but as it turned out, I kept my hair color, not that it dropped my value any.” Her words trail off as she goes back to sniffing. “Look…uh…Polly…?” The other dog pauses sniffing you just long enough to nod. “Polly, could you tell me just what’s going on here? Am I really what I think I am, or is this all some stupid trick.”

“Oh, you’re a dog all right, or more accurately a Nuevo-dog like me. The act of bestiality has a queer effect here, almost as if nature wants to correct a mistake or something. It surprised me too, but I’m used to it now.”

“Then you really were human once?” You really aren’t all that surprised, but you are curious. “Oh yes, I was a guest here back when this was the location of a dude ranch. I wanted to get back to nature and I guess I succeeded.” Polly sits down as she brings her hind leg up to scratch behind her ear. “They built this hotel because they needed the extra room for all the Nuevo-dogs, plus it’s more secure. They don’t want any of us generation zero types getting out without their say-so.”

“You make it sound like a prison.” Polly stops scratching long enough to nod again. “It is, in a way. There was an escape some years ago, a drifter named Sam, I was told. He managed to get back East where he was involved in conning some poor sap into murdering a bunch of people in New York. But that’s not your concern, or mine because we're just property now. You’ll get used to it, you’ll see.”

“Why are they doing this?” Why are they turning people into dogs?” You feel a panic attack setting in, so Polly approaches you, affectionately nuzzling your face with her nose, licking your furry cheek to calm you. “To mate, silly! Our puppies will be worth a lot of money on the open market because they share a good deal of our human intelligence. Our breed is particularly in demand for use as police dogs, and dogs for the military, so I expect you'll be pretty busy.”

You mull over what Polly said. The idea that the hotel is a front for a puppy-mill explains a few things, but you still have a lot of questions that need answering. In the meantime, you need to get used to the new you. You take a tentative step forward with your front legs, pushing forward until your back legs move in sympathy as you manage to slowly cross the room. Then you put all your effort into turning around, moving back past Polly and toward the bathroom vanity. The mirror is above you, so you gather yourself up to lift your foreparts until you manage to grab onto the marble top.

A dogs face greets you from inside the mirror, mostly black across the muzzle, flowing back as it changes to tan for most of your furry head, except around the eyes, which stare back at you with a mournful expression. On top of your head is another splash of black fur, patterned symmetrically between two large pointed ears that stand up like radar dishes. Fascinated, you try to reach up and touch your new face, but you discover that paws do not bend with the same versatility of human arms and hands so you give up. Then you feel a slight puffing around your asshole as Polly begins to explore you from behind again.

“Why do you do that?” You look down at the female Shepherd as she pulls back, cocking her head to one side. “Because it’s interesting.” She answers honestly. “You will find that you need your nose as much as your eyes in gathering information. It makes up for not having fingers to touch with and bare skin to feel. Why don’t you give it a try?” Polly turns around, raising her tail as an invitation. “That’s okay, I can smell you fine from here.” You slide off the vanity until you are back at floor level. “Max, take a sniff…a deep one. You’ll know what I’m talking about.” You are about to reply when you find yourself suddenly curious. You approach her tail hesitantly, taking a few sample sniffs to get an idea of what you’re getting into. “No, no, Max.” Polly sounds impatient. “I want you to get in there and take a good-hard-sniff, and just focus on the asshole, I’ll let you explore the rest later on.” You shift your focus from her eyes to her tail, trying to decide if this is a good idea or not. Then you throw caution to the wind and push your pointed snout firmly up Polly's anus, inhaling deeply.

An explosion of sensation charges up your snout and into your brain, almost as if lightning is arcing inside your skull. In an instant you feel intimately connected to the other animal as you use the power of your canine nose to explore, not just outside of Polly, but inside her as well. You can clearly sense all that is going on within Polly’s body, from her rectum, all the way through her intestinal tract. You can actually smell Polly’s last meal fermenting inside of her, and waste from previous meals being processed in her colon. The sharpness of the odors excites your senses as they cascade up and down the tightly packed receptors of your nose in physical waves. You can tell that Polly moved her bowels recently. "Max” You detect faint traces of residue along her… “MAX!” You snap out of your reverie. “Huh…Wha…?” You respond slowly. “As much as I enjoy a cold nose up my ass, I think we have visitors.”

You hear someone working the lock to the door of your room. Polly trots out of the bathroom as you follow her more slowly along the slippery floor. The blond German shepherd sits down, facing the doorway as you try to mimic her, sitting down, somewhat clumsily, by her side as the door opens.

The first one through the door you recognize immediately as the Concierge, followed by the mustachioed desk clerk and a woman, dressed in business attire. They look you up and down, but don’t approach. “Okay fido.” The woman addresses you directly. “We can do this the easy way, or the hard way.”
1111311122111.title: You panic a little

choices: You have no choice but to go to the Vet.
11113111221111.content:
Two large men wearing plain blue coveralls walk in from the hallway, one carrying a long metal pole with a canvas loop on one end. The sight of it makes you nervous to the point where you begin to growl without realizing it. “Max! Calm down! It’s just a precaution.” Polly warns you urgently, so you hold still as the loop is dropped around your neck and pulled tight, a little too tight. “Hey, lady. Can you tell this goon I like to breath?” The well-dressed woman looks at you, but does not seem to acknowledge what you’re saying. “Max. She doesn’t understand you. You’re a dog, remember?” Polly sounds exasperated as she chides you. The woman continues to look at you with a weird cold smile fixed on her carefully made-up face, not saying anything as she stares directly into your eyes. As you stare back, you realize that she is actually rather young and pretty, once you look past the man-eater business suit and the severely tied back hairstyle, with a nice smell under her perfume.

“August..?” She seems to be addressing the little desk clerk without shifting her eyes off of you. “I think I hear water running.” The mustachioed clerk tsks as he walks into the bathroom. You hear the shower being turned off before he re-emerges, grinning as he carries your shower kit, crooked under his arm, and the shredded remains of your filthy underwear hooked on his little finger. “It looks like this one didn’t even get out of the bathroom!” The men gathered in your room have a good laugh, but the woman looks disgusted, making you feel deeply embarrassed when you realize that they are all well aware of what happened last night. “Leave that for the cleaning crew, August, just repack our guest’s bag and find his keys. I don’t want his car sitting in the lot all day.” The clerk drops your soiled boxers and heads over to your bag where you left it last night, replacing items you took out as you searched for your shower kit. Then you remember that all your travel cash and credit cards are in that bag. “Hey! Get away from there, you…OW!!…FUCK!!” You are stopped short by a jolt of electricity that blasts you through the restraining loop around your neck, forcing you into silence as you helplessly watch your belongings being packed up. “I think that Polly will need treatment and a bath after her hot date last night. Will you take care of that, Rutherford?” The Concierge nods in agreement, producing a leather lead from his pocket. “Here, Polly. Time to go.” The blond German shepherd hops up to her feet, her tail wagging as she trots happily up to the Concierge who gives her a friendly pat in return before hooking the lead to her collar. You feel pangs of jealousy flow through you, as you watch your lover being given so much praise and attention, before you realize what’s happening. “Wait! Polly! Where are you going?” You panic as you realize that you’re being left alone, but Polly isn’t paying any attention to you as she drinks up the praise being heaped on her. Leashed once more, the blond German shepherd sits obediently at the Concierge’s feet as the latter turns to address the young woman. “Will that be all, Miss Winter?” The well-dressed woman shifts her focus from your eyes as she starts to look over the rest of you. “See that Polly gets a treat before you put her away. Thank you Rutherford.” The Concierge gives a short bow in acknowledgement before leaving your room with Polly in tow. “Polly!” You start getting up, but a warning tug from the man holding the restraining pole stops you. “See you later, Max. Remember what I said about property.” Polly’s last words fade away as she disappears into the hallway, leaving you feeling alone and helpless.

“Will you stand up please…” Miss Winter looks inquiringly to the little desk clerk, who is reviewing at the contents of your wallet. “Max, Mademoiselle.” The woman turns back to you. “Up, Max” You stand, feeling nervous, but you decide not to show it. The woman lets out a low whistle, as she looks you over until the desk clerk breaks the silence. “You see? I told you. The moment this one came up to my counter, I knew that he had a tremendous Feral Potential. It is the glint in the eyes that give it away, you see?”

“Shut up, August.” Miss Winter looks annoyed as the mustachioed desk clerk is fairly dancing with excitement, but instead of shutting up, he turns on her defiantly, standing up on his toes in a vain effort to look bigger. “You do not have the right to speak to me like that, Miss Winter. I am not just an employee here, but a partner! And my name is not pronounced ‘August’, but Aw-GOOST!”

“Well, Aw-GOOST, the sooner our guest is processed and put to work, the sooner we make money. I think we can place Max here in the upper bracket, so no mongrels. And put him into the advanced program, I think Hans will be glad to have him. I want him looking good for our clients. Take some photos of Max and send them to our friend at the kennel in Florida. I want a sire-match and a breeding line dummied up so we can get Max’s AKC papers. Can you do that for me…partner?” The little desk clerk gives Miss Winter a dirty look as he gestures to the man holding the restraining pole, but the well-dressed woman steps into your path, bending down until her face is just inches from your nose. “Max? We are going to be taking you down to our vet for a check up and a bath. If you are a good doggy, I will let you have Polly for five minutes before bedtime tonight. But if you are a bad doggy, I’ll see that you’re fixed and sold to a junkyard in New Jersey. Do I make myself clear?” You nod nervously as her eyes bore into you. Satisfied that you are being cooperative, Miss Winter steps aside as you are ushered unceremoniously out of the room. Your life as an animal is just beginning.
11113111221111.title: You choose the easy way.

choices: You decide to investigate the screams
111131112211111.content:
“Hey, slow down! I’m not used to this yet!” The large man with the pole restraint hooked up to your neck pushes you out the door of your room as you struggle with the slippery marble floor and having to get used to walking with four feet instead of two. The desk clerk is leading the way just ahead of you, so your field of view is blocked until you get the fright of your life.

“RRAAARRRR!!!” A huge figure wearing a thick padded suit lunges at you from somewhere in the hallway, his arms up menacingly as two malevolent piggy-eyes glare down at you from the narrow slit of a catcher’s mask strapped over his head. You are caught so completely by surprise that you let out a strangled Yipe, whining with your tail reflexively down between your legs as you attempt to sidle over to the opposite wall. The brute in the mask lets out a cruel laugh as you struggle against the pole restraint. “Haw Haw! Got yew, ya mutt!” You can see the man’s big yellow teeth grinning from inside his mask as your heart races uncontrollably. “YOU BASTARD! LET ME OUT OF THIS THING, I’LL..YOWW!!” The shock collar zaps you as you flail helplessly across the slippery floor. “YOU ASSHOLES! WHAT’S THE BIG …AAAOOWW!!” The shock collar hits you again as the man in the padded suit laughs even harder. You look around for support, but the desk clerk only glares at you like you’re the problem. “There gonna cut yer nuts off, boy! RRAARRR!!” The man in the padded suit lunges at you again, but the pole restraint keeps you from moving very far. Then you feel yourself being physically dragged along the hallway, leaving the man in the suit behind. “Wait a minute! What did I do wrong? He’s the…” Your protests are cut short as you feel the sharp blow as the man in the padded suit kicks you in the ass.

“YOU FUCKER!! I’LL RIP YOUR NUTS OFF!!” The kick is the last straw. You turn around, scrabbling along the marble floor with all of your strength, actually pulling the attendant holding the pole along with you as you charge the man in the padded suit who stays mockingly out of reach. Jolt after jolt of raw electricity courses through your body, but you hardly feel it anymore. All you want to do is sink your teeth in that bastard’s throat!” “GODDAMN MOTHERFUCKER!! I’LL TEAR YOUR LIVER OUT AND EAT IT!!”

“Stop him! Shock him!” You hear the desk clerk’s voice, pitched high with panic as he shouts orders to the nearly helpless attendant. “I am, sir! I have the setting all the way up but he’s just not paying any attention to it! “GET ME OUT OF THIS THING, YOU COCKSUCKERS!! I WANNA TEAR THIS GUYS HEAD OFF!! I WANNA SHIT DOWN HIS NECK!! I WAH!! RRAAHH!! RRAARRARGFF!!! RRAARRGG!! RRRAARRAAHHRRRFF!!” Your angry cries become less and less coherent to you as you see red. Your teeth are bared menacingly, your fur stands up, your eyes glow with white-hot rage as you pull forward step by step against the restraint pole. Nothing matters except getting at your tormentor and killing him.

“GRADY!! GET OVER HERE! NOW!” It’s the woman in the suit, Miss Winter, standing in the doorway of your former room, looking extremely angry, as Grady, acting like a schoolboy caught in a prank, rolls his eyes comically, before trundling over to her like an overweight dancing bear. “Sorry, Miss Winter. Jus’ havin’ a little fun, tha’s all.” The humor in Grady’s voice reflects the emptiness of his apology. “I don’t think you understand that we are in business to make money, NOT HAVE FUN! That one was cooperating, so save your jokes for the one’s that don’t. Understand?” Miss Winter scolds Grady as you slowly feel your senses coming back to you. You want to listen, but you feel the tug of the restraint pole again, this time the second attendant has joined the first as you are dragged bodily down the hall and into a waiting elevator. “NEXT TIME, FUCKER.” You shout into the hall as the doors close in front of you. “I SWEAR TO GOD, I’M GONNA PISS ON YOUR CORPSE!!”

You sit on the floor of the elevator, visibly shaking as you bleed off adrenaline. Is this what your life is now? Polly’s words echo in your head. Property. You’re just property now. Be a good doggy or they beat you. Be a good doggy or they shock you. Be a good doggy or they stick a needle in your butt and put you down. Everything, and everyone you know is gone now. There’s no waking up from this nightmare. What the hell happened back there? It was like your brain completely disconnected from your body while you were still aware of yourself. Is this what being a dog is like when the human side is gone? The thought makes you shake even more as the elevator doors slide open, and you are ushered out.

“New resident for processing.” The desk clerk addresses a bored looking receptionist wearing a nurse’s uniform, sitting at her station behind a window set in the wall. She writes something down on a clipboard before responding. “I’ll tell the doctor that you’re here.” You sit on the linoleum floor feeling a little sick as you become aware of the various scents of people, dogs and chemicals. Eventually, someone calls your name out and you’re taken to an examination room, where a female vet with long brown hair, greets you with a friendly smile. “I know this is a big change for you, but don’t try to talk, okay? Talking doesn’t work anymore. You just answer my questions with a nod or by shaking your head. Okay?” You nod as the attendant with the pole restraint helps you hop up on a table.

You take the indignities of your examination in silence, hardly noticing the poking and prodding, the needles or even the thermometer up your ass. The vet asks you questions about your human habits and medical condition, noting your nods and shakes on a checklist as you decide that the vet is actually pretty nice. Unlike Miss Winter, the vets’ smile is warm and friendly, so you begin to relax until she puts on a fresh pair of rubber gloves, spreading lubricant from a tube along her fingers as she produces an empty glass vial. “I’m going to need a sperm sample, so just relax and hold still for a minute.” The Vet reaches under you, enclosing her warm lubricated hand over your genitals, stroking gently over your furry shaft until you feel your naked penis exposing itself like lipstick from a tube. The feeling is very strange. Your genitals are sheathed in fur, but your exposed penis is naked and very sensitive. The Vet strokes you off as you find yourself lewdly moving your hips in sympathy with her actions. The feeling is electric. Your tail wags as you lick the Vet’s face gratefully, feeling so much better, as the Vet expertly slips the glass vial under the head of your penis as you bark with pleasure. “All done! Good boy…Good boy!” The Vet’s kind words make you feel warm and happy for some reason. You’re not even bothered when the attendant with the restraining pole around your neck directs you out of the examination room. “Now take your bath like a good boy, and I’ll have your present ready after you’re done. Okay?” You bark an answer, then add a quick nod to underline that you understand her. Maybe there are some people here that aren’t so bad after all.

The bath is pleasurable as you feel the filth of your human existence being washed away. You step out of the tub, dragging the weight of the soapy water soaking your fur, so you shake yourself instinctively, feeling your skin move in great sweeps over your body, as droplets of water fly everywhere. As the attendant dries you off with a soft towel, you realize that this is the first bath you had since before you left on your trip. You sniff your flank a little regretfully now that your natural scent is covered with a soapy chemical smell but time will take care of that. The attendant brings out a brush and works your fur with it in long firm strokes, opening your pores and letting your skin breath, so by the time your fur is soft and shiny your unpleasant experience in the hallway has faded into the background of your day. He finishes, just as the Vet walks in holding something red in her hand. “Here’s your present, Max.” She holds out a new leather collar, adorned with various vaccination tags, and a special gold tag, stamped with the word ‘MAX’. She fixes it around your neck as you get a chance to give her a good sniff, pleased that she has a nice friendly smell. “We’re going to let you walk with a leash for now, Max, so be good. Tomorrow you will begin your training, so get a good night’s sleep. Okay?” You nod as the attendant hooks a leather lead to a metal clasp on your collar, leading you out to the reception area. You’re just about to leave when you hear a woman scream.

The receptionist perks up, cursing softly as she turns to the attendant. “You better come help.” The attendant drags you to a metal bar set in the wall, sliding a latch over before looping the end of the leash along the bar, leaving you alone as he charges off in the direction of the screams. What’s going on back there? You want to investigate, but the leash keeps you from moving very far. Then you notice that the bar holding the end of the leash isn’t fully locked. You nuzzle the latch, then swat at it clumsily with your paw until the loop end of the leash pops free.
111131112211111.title: You have no choice but to go to the Vet.

1111311122111111.content:
You follow the sounds of screaming down a corridor, past rooms full of file cabinets and servers to a pair of iron bound doors, one of which is partially open. As you approach, you hear other voices, so you enter quietly, moving along the wall, using wooden crates as cover until you see a young woman who has been bound up hand and foot with padded leather straps, suspended in mid air, spread eagle, just off the floor. You then catch sight of the profile of a dog; a well-brushed Irish setter, sitting patiently, facing the woman in line with her crotch, which is the only part of her still clothed. The rest of the woman’s garments are in tatters; the remains of a uniform, similar to the one worn by the receptionist. The bound up woman is young and pretty, with shoulder-length red hair and green eyes that dart about with fear.

“You were caught in the records room, weren’t you Tiffany?” Out of the shadows you see Miss Winter approach the helpless woman, looking at her with that same cold smile she gave you earlier. “I was looking for..” The bound up woman attempts to explain, but she is stopped short by a slap across her face. “Don’t lie to me! We know what you were looking for; we put a keyboard trace on every computer here. You were looking for a file, and you found it in the restricted area. Rutherford.” The Concierge walks up, handing her a file folder. Miss Winter looks it over, smiling again, this time showing some genuine humor. “Ah, yes. We should have picked up on this earlier, but then May looked more like you then, than she does now. But as you know, we have a way of making you two match all over again.”

The bound up woman lets out a gasp, as she renews her struggle against the bindings holding her wrists and ankles. “She’s my older sister.” The bound up woman confesses. “I came here to see what became of her. I was told that she died in a car crash, but she lost the tip of her right index finger when we were children. The body in the morgue had all her fingers, so I searched for her, following her most likely routes from school.”

“So you got a job here with us. My dear, all you had to do was ask, and we would have been happy to let you see where we keep her now. You want to find your sister, and we will be more than happy to accommodate you. In fact, I will even arrange to have you placed in the pen, right next to hers.” Miss Winter walks slowly up to the Irish setter, running her well-manicured fingers over the dog’s head and under its chin, as the dog holds still like a statue. “She's made so many lovely dogs for us, and now you will do the same.” The redheaded woman cries out in fear, redoubling her efforts to get loose as Miss Winter walks up to her. She reaches down to fondle the bound woman’s firm round breasts as her victim looks away in disgust. “You know, I could have fancied you. You’re quite pretty without your uniform. It’s a shame to trade these in for six little nipples on your belly, but I’m sure that your puppies will appreciate them. And you are going to make so many bright little puppies for us, won’t you, Tiffany? Miss Winter’s hand moves from the bound woman’s breasts, down along her flat belly and in through the top of her pink-silk panties. Smiling wickedly, she brings her face down to her victim’s ear, kissing her cheek as she moves her hidden hand vigorously under the material of Tiffany’s undergarment, until the smell of fear becomes mixed with the scent of human arousal. “Do you want to know a secret, Tiffany? I hate dogs. I hate the way they slobber. I hate the way they… smell. But what I don’t hate is how they make me money, and that’s what it's all about.” Miss Winter retrieves her fingers from inside Tiffany’s panties, sticking them in her mouth, as she tastes the other woman’s sweat with no small satisfaction before she continues. “We have just three rules here. We don’t question orders, we don’t have sex with the livestock, and we… don’t… SPY!” With her last word, Miss Winter tears off the bound woman’s panties, revealing Tiffany’s glistening sex as the victim screams in panic. Realizing what’s about to happen, you take a step forward.

“Stay out of it.” You freeze when you see the Irish setter looking directly at you. “She’s my prey. Stay out it.”

“Tod?” The Irish setter’s head snaps back to face front. “Will you show little Tiffany a good time?” The bound up woman let’s out a wail of terror as the dog happily trots up to her exposed vagina and anus, sniffing enthusiastically as she struggles against the restraints. “I won’t tell! I promise I won’t tell anyone!” The woman shrieks in fear as she realizes that her humanity is about to be stripped away, but Miss Winter just grins. “You are right about that, my dear. You won’t be telling anyone, anything at all.” The Irish setter starts lapping away at Tiffany’s anus and vagina, his tail wagging as he savors the bound up woman’s flavor and scent. As the licking continues, you notice that Tiffany’s struggles are becoming less and less focused, her eyes glazing over as her body starts to respond sexually. From your hiding place, you can smell the excitement rising in the bound woman, in spite of her protests, as her body reacts to the constant animal stimulation. “Oh!…Oh!…Oh!” Tiffany gasps for breath as you see her shifting her body, not to escape, but to give the dog a better angle of attack. The Irish setter’s tongue explores deep in the crevices of Tiffany’s sex, massaging her in preparation for their inevitable act of bestiality. “Oh, god!..Oh No!…OH NO!” The dog’s tongue has done its work. Tiffany’s body is glistening with sweat, her resistance all but gone as the Irish setter mounts her from the front, wrapping his forelegs around the woman’s torso with deliberate slowness. You watch in horrid fascination as the dog hunches up, twisting and gyrating his hindquarters lewdly as his naked canine penis searches by feel for the entrance into Tiffany’s body. 1111311122111111111112121111212.content:
Just why is Grady being so nice to you?

You recall your previous encounter with the sadistic dog-handler, and you find yourself more than just a little suspicious. So you pull back on your hunger, settling on carefully sniffing the blood-red treat in search of a hidden surprise.

“Whaz th’ matter, ya dumm mutt?” Grady seems perplexed. “Go on…EAT!”

You keep sniffing, trying to filter out the food elements, but it’s hard to pick up anything with all the background odors; gasoline, exhaust smoke and motor oil, then a sudden realization hits you like a thunderbolt. You’re just one door away from freedom!

“Eat that slop, ya filthy Cur, or I’ll force it down yer mangy throat!” Grady lumbers at you like an angry bear, his arms out as he prepares to push your nose in the dog dish, so you jump out of his grasp, accidentally kicking the bowl under his oversized, padded feet. “YAAWWP!!” The monstrous dog-trainer steps directly into the dog-dish, slipping on the bloody chunks of meat and falling over backwards with a heavy thump, knocking the wind out of him, but you don’t have time to enjoy the spectacle.

“The door…gotta get past that door!” You dash up to the over-sized portal, pushing up against the oil-streaked aluminum alloy a moment, before sniffing along its entire width in search of a gap big enough to squeeze through, finally whining and barking out of frustration. “Think, Dammit! Stop being a dog for a moment and THINK!” You force yourself to take a step backward, looking at the door carefully in an effort to remember how it works.

The door goes….up! It moves on a track…there it is! It looks too heavy to lift, but it might be electric….electric….that word means something; your brain tries to push itself through the fog until the image of a large circular object….a button comes into your head. “There must me a button that makes to door move out of the way!” You look around, past the steel drums and toolboxes, past the dog-trainer Grady as he struggles vainly to get off his back, to the door you first entered, next to which is a panel of over-sized buttons. “Push the buttons…and the door…goes…UP!” You dash past Grady to the panel, neatly side-stepping a clumsy attempt to grab you by the still prone dog-trainer to the panel, swatting the buttons at random until you are rewarded with the mechanical sound of the big garage doors rolling open.

“Stop ‘im! Git ‘im!” You charge back to the disappearing doors as three of them move slowly up and out of the way. Grady is still unable to get on his feet, temporarily trapped by his heavy padded suit, but a man and a woman, dressed in plain blue overalls, dash at you from the open doors of a plain white van, parked just outside, each holding poles with rope loops attached to them. But they simply aren’t fast enough to stop you as you easily evade capture and sprint for freedom of the outdoors and into a small parking lot at what looks to be the extreme edge of the complex. You see a chain link fence bordering the lot, your only remaining barrier to the open desert beyond, but thankfully it’s neglected, with several gaps visible, so you tear ahead at a full run, easily leaving the two pole-wielding workers in the dust, when you hear a noise that makes you stop short, angry barking, intermixed with an occasional yelp of pain and fear. “POLLY!” You realize that Grady must have led the blond German shepherd into some sort of trap, a vision of Doberman Pinchers sporting skull emblazoned collars closing in on her with fangs bared, flashes into your brain. Momentarily halted, you find yourself in a dilemma. Do you keep on running to freedom, or do you go back to try and save Polly?

What do you do?
1111311122111111111112121111212.title: You decide to check before you eat.

11113111221111111111121211112121.content:
You’re momentarily torn between freedom and rushing to the rescue, when freedom narrowly wins. You dash through the gap in the chain link fence and into the hard-baked desert, just a fraction of a second before on of the workers, holding a long pole, manages to get a loop over your neck.

“So long, suckers!” You call back at your would-be captors, not caring that they could not understand what you said. You use your well-toned canine body to great advantage, tearing across the desert, around cacti and short, scrubby plants, feeling the heady rush of the heated breeze rushing in your ears and up you nostrils. The ground rises up under you, as you find yourself on a low hill, looking down into the Dog Pound Hotel complex’s, rear parking area. Then you catch sight of something that stops you in your tracks.

You see Polly down in the parking lot, surrounded by a pack of snarling Doberman guard dogs, running circles around the blond German shepherd as she fights a losing battle, to keep them at bay. Though larger and more heavily built than her tormentors, you can see that Polly is no match for her more agile opponents, who take every opportunity to charge in for a bite, the moment she is distracted by one of their pack-mates. In desperation, the blond German shepherd is spinning in circles, yelping and snapping at the air, trying in vain to keep them away, but you know that it’s only a matter of time before she is brought down by the bloodthirsty pack.

A strange feeling comes over you. You hear growling, deep and menacing, even before you realize that the noise is coming from you. Your hackles rise up on your back, as you feel your muscles tense up under your thick fur. You breathe in the warm desert air, with its various scents: plants, insects, rotting matter and something else, an odd animal scent somewhere nearby, but you have no time to analyze what it might be. Like a bullet from a gun, you find yourself charging across the desert, not to freedom, but to the rescue, ignoring your own brain as it shouts for you to keep on escaping. You can't help yourself. The sight of Polly being mobbed strikes at you on a primal level you were not even aware of until that moment. All you can think about is ‘a bunch of them are attacking one of yours!’ You charge headlong into the knot of attackers, lowering your head as you run into, first one, and then another Doberman, knocking them both down and out of the way as you dash to Polly’s side.

“MAX?!” Polly’s eyes are wide with surprise. You can tell she is reaching her physical and mental limit, breathing heavily, her tongue hanging out as she struggles to cool herself, the scent of blood emanating from her body, the result of multiple bite wounds she suffered under the fangs of her tormentors.

“We have to get out of here.” Your keen eyes cast about for a suitable escape route, but the Doberman guard dogs seem to have them covered.

“Well, looky what we have here…” A large male Doberman steps forward, his fangs bared. “Two meals for the price of one!” The Lead Doberman’s comment is met with a wave of cruel chuckles from his subordinates.

“Let us pass, and you won’t get hurt, bobtail.” You give a warning growl, but your display of aggressiveness only seems to increase the Lead Doberman’s amusement.

“You’re all bark, victim.” The head Doberman chuckles dryly. “The only place you’re going to, is a pet cemetery.”

“Care to prove that, one on one?” You take a step forward, your fangs bared as your muscles tense up in preparation for a fight.

“Sorry pal. You get me, you get the whole pack” The head Doberman gives a short nod in a direction off your left shoulder, just as Polly shouts a warning.

“Max! Look out!” You spin in place just as you feel razor sharp fangs dig into your hind flank. You lunge at your attacker, but your jaws snap air as the attacking Doberman dashes away. Your anger builds, as you fight the urge to charge blindly after the dog that bit you, just as another warning from Polly forces you to spin the other way. This time, Polly manages to block the new attack, but at the cost of being bitten herself from behind by a different guard dog. You whirl about just as the dog that bit Polly darts out of reach, but this time, you keep turning a full 360 degrees, catching the next Doberman while he is still inbound, his slavering jaws a blur of razor-sharp teeth, his eyes only now beginning to register that he has been caught flat-footed. The Doberman is too fast for you to avoid, forcing you to make a split-second decision to accept a vicious bite on your shoulder, a moment before as you clamp your vice-like jaws down on the back of his black-furred neck.

You grimace at the pain of the Doberman’s fangs as they easily break through your thick fur and on into muscle, but you won’t let go, using the pain to bite down harder, blood from the Doberman spreading inside your mouth as you breath in the heady scent of panic. Then the Doberman breaks contact, yelping in panic and thrashing wildly as you begin to instinctively shake him like a rag doll. You won’t let go… you can’t let go! The feeling of prey in your jaws is too exquisite, forcing you to bite down harder with canine ecstasy. Not even the feel of another bite on your hind flank can stop your powerful jaws from their primal goal of closing completely, until you feel something under the unfortunate Doberman’s neck give with a sickening snap: the wretched canine suddenly going limp, as time stops around you.

Unlocking your jaws, you allow the corpse to drop to the ground like a broken toy, the taste of blood in your mouth somehow managing to excite and sicken you at the same time, as you blink like a man who just woke up from a dream. You look around, marveling at the stark unreality, as everything around you seems to be moving in slow motion. The Doberman guards are all frozen in place, their jaws agape in shock at the sight of one of their own being killed so easily. Then shock gives way to snarling anger, as you realize that their next attack will be to the death.

“Polly.” You find yourself panting with exhaustion as your adrenaline rush subsides. “Get behind me, I’ll watch your tail, you watch mine.” You gather your remaining energy, preparing for the coming massacre, when you hear a strange sound, like a high-pitched whistle penetrate your ears. For a moment, you wonder if you just imagining it, when you see that the Doberman’s ears perk up as well, looking at each other as they step back.

“Max, can you hear me?” A familiar voice breaks the spell. You look over Polly’s back to see a group of Dog Pound personnel walking toward you, led by Miss Winter and the female Kennel Vet. “Stay right where you are. If you try to escape, the guards have the authority to kill. Do you understand?”
11113111221111111111121211112121.title: Keep running to freedom

111131112211111111111212111121211.content:
You find yourself trying to form you mouth into a spoken reply before you realize that is no longer possible, so you settle for a short bark, sitting down despite the heat being given off by the asphalt surface of the parking lot. The Vet rushes through the cordon of unhappy Dobermans, first checking their dead comrade, before tending to Polly’s wounds. You sit there, totally drained, staring down at the still form of the guard dog you just killed, wondering who he was before he got changed into an animal, and whether he deserved it. Then a wave of nausea rolls through your body as the taste and smell of his blood in your mouth makes you suddenly jump back on your feet as you try to vomit but there is nothing left in your stomach to bring up. Your action creates a ripple of snarls from the Dobermans, but another whistle sound calms them down again.

“Well?” Miss Winter sounds impatient as she addresses the female Vet.

“Max has some Puncture wounds…nothing serious.” The Vet runs her fingers expertly over your fur. “Polly will need a few stitches, but I’m sorry to say that the guard dog is dead…broken neck.” Miss Winter says something under her breath, just as Grady lumbers into the parking lot.

“Grady?” Miss Winter does not even turn to acknowledge the overweight dog handler's arrival. “Could you explain to me how two of our residents got so far past security and nearly got away?”

“No idea, Miss Winter.” Grady is breathing heavy, likely because he had to run through the buildings, rather than going directly to the parking lot from the garage. “They’s clever mutts, tha’s fer sure. I told ye’ before that we need t’ kick more o’ they furry butts if we wanna keep ‘em in line.”

“Bastard…” you say to yourself, letting out a low growl to register your displeasure until the vet feeds you a biscuit of some sort. Anger momentarily forgotten, you gobble down the treat, feeling much better as you lick your lips with satisfaction: the feel of the Lady Vet rubbing the fur on your head, strangely hypnotic.

“Clever… Yes….” Miss Winter turns to face the well-padded dog trainer. “Then maybe you can tell me how our two escaped Huskies managed to lock themselves in a storage room in the Environmental Services building, while somehow managing to take their food and cages with them?”

Grady looks suddenly surprised, his usual grin disappearing, along with the color in his face. “N-no, ma’am, I don’t.” He replies mechanically.

“I see…” Miss Winter seems to be digesting the information. “And you have nothing further to add about this incident?”

“No Ma’am.” A tentative grin begins to spread across the over sized dog trainer’s face.

“Very well.” Miss Winter steps to one side, sweeping an elegant hand in your direction. “Take Max and Polly to the medical wing. After that, I will have no further need of you.”

“Yes Ma’am! C’mon you Mutts!” Grady approaches you, his grin wide with malice. But before you realize it, you are on your feet again; ready to fight, hunger and fatigue forgotten as you snarl, head down, teeth bared. You’re not going to let him take you and Polly away, knowing full well what will happen, once he has you alone.

“Don’t you take tha’ tone w’ me, Boy!” Grady is momentarily stopped in his tracks, actually taking a step backward, despite the heavy protective suit he’s wearing. Something deep inside you is welling up, something primal, blending with all of the indignities you have had to endure, from living like an animal, to being forced to kill another of your kind, and the set up that nearly cost Polly her life. But the reasons why don’t seem to matter that much anymore. All you can think about is how much you hate this man.

“He doesn’t want to go with you, Grady.” Miss Winter strikes an offhand pose, her expression one of mock surprise. “Is it possible our Maxie knows something you don’t want me to know?”

“He’s jus’ crazy, Miss Winter!” Grady replies angrily. “Theys brains get tetched when they make th’ change, you know that. Gimme five minutes alone with ‘im, and I’ll put ‘im right again.”

“You think that you know these creatures?!” Miss Winter’s mask of calm falls away. “You may understand Dogs, Mr. Grady, but you do not understand them, or me! Before we broke you out of that chain gang, we were told that you were the best dog-fighting trainer and wrangler in the business. We sheltered you from the law, paid you well; we even overlooked those incidents where your callous actions cost us potentially valuable breeding stock. But you crossed the line when you decided to go into business for yourself!”

“Miss Winter, Ma’am…” Grady pulls off his heavy head gear, revealing a pale, pudgy, misshapen head, shaved smooth except for a close trimmed beard ringing his puffy, tobacco-stained lips. “Ye’ know I Didn’ do nothin’…tha Mutt is lyin!”

“Remove him, please.” Miss Winter doesn’t move, but two severe looking men, wearing dark suits, emerge from the shadows. Grady sees them coming, his pallid skin sweating visibly.

“Pleaz, Miz Winter!” The men in suits grab each of Grady's well padded arms, his padded headgear dropping to the asphalt with hollow thud.

“Your services are no longer required.” She says simply.

The sound of Miss Winter’s death sentence still echoing in his ears, something snaps in the sadistic Dog Handler as he suddenly throws the two men away from him like toys! More men approach, but Grady isn't interested in escape, only revenge, as the over-sized Dog Handler unexpectedly turns on YOU!”

“I'm gonna Kill ya', Boy!” He bellows.

Showing surprising speed, the Dog Trainer charges you, teeth bared, blood in his eyes, he closes in on you fast, his bulk looming over you like the shadow of a giant storm cloud!

What do you do?
111131112211111111111212111121211.title: Stay put

1111311122111111111112121111212111.content:
Grady charges you, his ham sized fists wrapped in the dirty, padded fabric of his Dog Trainer costume, wind milling down at you so quickly that you find yourself temporarily cornered up against a section of fencing just behind you. Taking advantage of your well toned body, you dart through a gap, avoiding the hammer blow from his arms, but not quite getting clear before a kick sends your hindquarters skidding out from under you, but your surprise is short lived as you roll out of the path of a massive padded boot, stomping down on the portion of sun-baked asphalt your head occupied just a moment earlier.

“Stop them!” You can hear the panicked voice of the female Vet somewhere hidden by the vast bulk of your assailant. “He’ll kill Max!”

“Let them fight.” That was Miss Winter, her voice carrying a hint of increasing excitement…or was it amusement? “I want to see just how much of an animal our Maxie really is.”

You don’t like the sound of what you are hearing, but you have too much on your plate to analyze what she means. You dodge another kick, retreating far enough away to open some distance, before suddenly charging back in, intent on knocking the fat slob down, but in spite of all your weight and muscle behind you, you find yourself bouncing off of the massive trainer like he was a mattress wrapped around a steel beam.

“Stupid mutt!” Grady catches you in mid-air on the rebound, smashing you down with surprising force as you find yourself smacking hard onto the hard dark surface of the parking lot, just before a savage kick to your mid-section sends you flying as you let out a yelp of pain. “C’mon Boy! Izzat allya got?!”

Anger builds up inside you as you roll to your feet, growling savagely, your hackles up and your fangs bared in challenge. Your focus narrows until all you can see is the shadowy bulk of your enemy. With a burst of incredible speed, you lunge at the sadistic dog handler, deliberately suppressing the strangely detached voice of your human side as you sink your razor-sharp fangs into one of Grady’s well-padded gauntlets.

“Gotcha mutt!” You tear futilely at the heavy padding, choking on the dust as you are struck hard with another savage kick, only this time you aren’t being knocked out of range. To your horror, you realize that your jaws won’t unlock! In desperation, you shake violently at the padding, hoping that you can break free, but it’s no good. You’re rocked by another brutal kick to your midsection, before you find yourself, still firmly latched to your enemy’s glove, flying up and over the dog trainer’s bald, tattooed head, as he slams you once more into the asphalt like you were a hammer, only this time you feel the heavy fabric between your jaws shred loose from the heavy padding of his gauntlet, allowing you to slide away, temporarily out of range of his attacks.

“Stupid, stupid, STUPID!” Your animal instincts subside as you get unsteadily back on your feet, and your human intellect regains control. This guy is not just a mountain of muscle, but he knows everything there is to know about subduing vicious dogs.

“C’mon Boy! I ain’t finished withya yet. C’MON!” Grady goads you, but you know that he’s guessed all your canine moves. Think, Dammit, THINK! You dash out of the way of another attack. The proximity of the building and the border fence is too restricting, so you move out to the center of the parking lot. Around you, you can see the crowd of humans and dogs watching the contest with a mixture of emotions, from horror to amusement. Not a few of the spectators would like to see your brains smashed all over the asphalt, but you have more important things to consider than whether you have the crowd on your side or not.

Grady is big and bulky, he also has the ability to shift his compass quicker on his two legs, than you can on four. But you have the advantage of speed, so you move in a wide arc, keeping warily out of reach as he turns to keep you to his front.

‘C’mn’ git it, ya Cur. I’ll smashya inta jelly!” Grady tries to taunt you into another frontal assault, but you aren’t listening to him anymore. You circle the massive dog-trainer, not taking your eyes off of him as he turns in place at the center of your orbit. You move faster and faster, building momentum with each step, as you study your enemy for weaknesses, the most glaring of which is the fact that he isn’t wearing any head covering. But how to get at his most vulnerable aspect, when it’s so far off the ground? Then it comes to you.

“C’MON YA MUTT! C’MN’ GIT SUM!” You can see Grady getting angrier and angrier, good! You can tell he’s getting tired of your circling, his human brain trying to think of a counter move to your unexpected tactic. Then the opening you were looking for appears, as he suddenly stops in place and begins to reverse direction, counter to your orbit, exposing his back to you, for a brief second, all the time you need.

With lighting speed, you dash in as Grady is still caught in his turn. The Dog Trainer’s suit is invulnerable to bite attacks, and from the front he can use his size and weight to counter any weight and momentum you can muster, but from behind, Grady’s human legs have a fatal weakness. With all your strength and built up momentum, you crash into Grady’s legs, taking special care to strike him just behind the knees.

“WAALLPP!!” Like a massive tree cut loose from it’s trunk, the massive dog trainer tumbles over backward, leaving you with barely enough time to dash out of the way before he hits the ground in a cloud of dust and a satisfying thump. Like a turtle on his back, Grady struggles to roll over, only to find you standing over him, pinning his chest and right arm down under your weight, your savage fangs just inches from his exposed throat as you growl menacingly.

“HALP! GITTIM OFFA ME! MISS WINNER, DON’ LETTIM KILL ME, PLEASE!” Grady’s terror filled eyes lock onto yours. The smell of his fear, and the blood coursing through his veins, just under the fat folds of his neck excites you in a way you never would have though possible until that moment.

“Kill the bastard.” Miss Winter’s voice breaks through to your conflicted brain.

“Don’ doit, boy!” Grady pleads, licking his fat lips nervously as sweat beads and flows down his bald head like rain. “I wuz good t’ ya…give ya meat an’ tail…Don’t kill me, PLEASE!” You have Grady pinned, his right arm held down tight, his left arm flailing uselessly out of range as you move in closer for the kill.

What do you do?
1111311122111111111112121111212111.title: Charge Grady
